text:
Tap (SOPP2016, Helsinki) (7+:4:8:4:16=3.9+)
Lovely buttered ryebread aroma. Taste similar. Palate light. Slightly sour buttery palate - bread-pudding kind of butteriness. Freaking delish. Finish is a bit dry, but makes you want to drink more. Alcohol pretty well covered. Kinda 1-dimensional, but utterly gorgeous. OK, the non-BA was good, but this is even better!

Hazy coppery/ambery colour, close to black. Aroma is toffee, some wood, liquorice and mild tobaccoish and rye notes. Flavour is nicely wooden and some toffeeish and fruity notes with a mild rye flavour to it as well.

Draught @ Syystober 2016. Aroma has sourish cherries, caramel and vanilla. Flavour has vanilla, sweetish malt, oaky notes and some sourish cherry notes. This has the same sour elements than in flamish reds - theyre just milder here. Finishes with hayish grain.

@ SOPP Helsinki 2016Brown hazy. Oaky woody, sweet malty nose. Full bodied, smooth, nice. Fruity dry dark fruity. This is pretty nice, nice mix of flavours, isnt too oaky or something else. Hope to get a bottle for sipping some time.-- tickstorrent/wp10
Tap at SOPP 2016, Helsinki. Colour is clear brown with very small white head. Wood, dryness, chocolate, dryness and malts. Very nice.

0,1l on tap @ SOPP Helsinki 2016. Pours clear deep amber with a low off-white head. Aroma is nutty malts, caramel and alcohol. Flavor is sweet slightly tarty malts with caramel, oak, alcohol and some hops. Great.

(Keg at SOPP Helsinki 2016) The beer poured dark brown and hazy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had vanilla, malts and rye. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were vineousness, rye bread, sweetness, vanilla, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was woody, malty and bitter. A very tasty brew with not too heavy barrel effects.

Draught @ SOPP 2016. Pours dark brown with a smooth head. Aroma of wood, oak, toffee, caramely malts, syrup and earthiness. Taste is smooth, earthy and malty with some toffee, syrup, caramel, wood and oak. Finish is oaky, woody and earthy with some toffee and syrup. Okay.
SOPP, Tampere 2016. Dark mahogany brown body, no head. Cognag, sweet malts, molasses and rich dark fruity caramel. So Sweet one.

Dark brown color, no head. Toffee, malts, vanilla in the nose. Light to medium-bodied. Raisins, vanilla, plum. Good viscosity. Nice sipping brew and the best one from Lammin Sahti for a while.
Tap @ Sopp. Pours dark brown, no head. Wood, fruits, vanilla, bourbon, sherry aroma. Sweet, smooth, fruity, rum, rich flavour.

Aroma has dark fruits, oak, vanilla. Taste is malty with quite bitter and sweet aftertaste. Flavors of dried fruits, oak, malt, vanilla.

Draught at the SOPP, Tampere, Finland.
Dark brown color with a tiny off-white head. 
Amazing aroma of sweetness, rum, alcohol and more sweetness. 
Rum sweetness in the flavor. Vanilla sweetness in there too. Amazing. The best beer in SOPP Tampere this year. Yummy! Huge difference to the normal version of Ruisrääkkä.

Tap @ SOPP Tampere 2016.
Pours dark mahogany color with a small head. Very nice bourbon vanilla aroma, wooden notes and caramel malts. Sweet vanilla flavor, very smooth creamy palate, wooden tingliness, roasted malts and some faint chocolate notes. Excellent.
5425
